Protocols

The following protocols are available globally.

  • WrappingDataTransaction

    Represents a DataTransaction that wraps another DataTransaction of a potentially different type.

    When a WrappingDataTransaction is executed, it may also execute the wrapped DataTransaction in order to perform some of its work.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public protocol WrappingDataTransaction: DataTransaction
  • DataTransaction

    An interface for an asynchronously-executing data transaction.

    See more

    Declaration

    Swift

    public protocol DataTransaction
  • QueueProvider

    Certain DataTransactions perform asynchronous operations using Grand Central Dispatch. Such DataTransactions will typically be given a QueueProvider at instantiation to supply a dispatch_queue_t when needed.

    By supplying a QueueProvider rather than a specific queue, reusable DataTransactions can be supplied with different queues over time.

    See more

    Declaration

    Swift

    public protocol QueueProvider
